docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 1--Half a dozen Left-Wing political leaders returned this afternoon from exile in Montevideo, Uruguay, and were received with great enthusiasm by large crowds.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 1--Half a dozen Left-Wing political leaders returned this afternoon from exile in Montevideo, Uruguay, and were received with great enthusiasm by large crowds.
docs.abstract: Drs N Repetto, A L Palacios, L Molinas and other Leftists return from exile in Montevideo; s, Communist and Socialist rallies; Vice Pres Peron attacked; R Ghildi states Communist party aims

headline.main: ARGENTINES CHEER RETURNED EXILES; 50,000 Attend Rallies at Which Repatriated Left-Wingers Assail Peron Regime

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2--The United States will propose that Britain jettison or drastically modify her system of empire trade preference controls as one condition of further financial aid from this country.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 4--Argentina's Under-Secretary of Foreign Affairs, Dr. Lucio Moreno Quintana, announced this afternoon that Dr. Oscar Ibarra Garcia, Ambassador to Washington, had been recalled and would not receive another foreign post for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 4--Argentina's Under-Secretary of Foreign Affairs, Dr. Lucio Moreno Quintana, announced this afternoon that Dr. Oscar Ibarra Garcia, Ambassador to Washington, had been recalled and would not receive another foreign post for the present.

docs.lead_paragraph: FROM Buenos Aires came word last week that Argentina has in preparation the printing of 20,000,000 5centavos stamps as a tribute to the unknown service men who died for the independence of Argentina and other South American countries early in the nineteenth century.

docs.snippet: Business in the foreign exchange market last week was quiet. The Canadian free dollar which had absorbed the major interest of traders in the preceding weeks because of its wide fluctuations settled down to a narrow price range on a minimum of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Business in the foreign exchange market last week was quiet. The Canadian free dollar which had absorbed the major interest of traders in the preceding weeks because of its wide fluctuations settled down to a narrow price range on a minimum of turnover. It alternated between 90.32 cents, and 89.88 cents, with the close on Saturday at 89.94 cents, a loss of 1/8 cent.
